page.title: 05Cornard Past and Present
page.content: Cornard 50 years ago had a population of about 1000. There was a garage,cafe, butchers,grocers,blacksmiths,nursery, post office and 3 public houses who brewed their own beer.Houses had oil lamps,outside toilets,fireplaces in all rooms,no upstairs lighting and few telephones.There were many allotments. Industry consisted of farming,a radiator factory and the Pot Kilns where lime was made.Many roads were bordered by fields with only a few houses mostly situated along Bures Rd Head Lane,Broom St. and around the Church.After 1950 Cornard grew with people rehoused from London.Today there are 8000 people.There are several estates mostly of semi-detached and town houses and a shopping area.There are 2 First Schools,a Middle and Upper school and community centre.There is an industrial estate linked by a Ring Rd.
